results.title: High jump
results.creator_credit: Ampol Petroleum Ltd and Ryan Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
The techniques and steps to successful performance in the highjump event. Shows the two main principles in high jumping, illustrated with diagrams, maximising lift in practice, pointing out faults in the style of the athlete; clearing the bar by the “role” method in which the body rotates over the bar; preparatory training exercises for athletes and training procedure being practised under the direction of a coach.

results.title: High heels
results.creator_credit: Sue Brooks and Victorian Women's Film Unit
results.brief_description: In the 1980’s high heels are back in fashion and women are back in high heels. Why is it feminine to walk in high heels? What does it do to your spine? Does a woman who is helpless need help? What is the appeal of restrictive fashion? And in what way do high heels restrict us? Why do women wear high heels? Written by Alison Tilson.

results.title: High grass circus
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Torben Schioler, Bill Brind, Colin Low and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A ticket to entertainment at the Royal Brothers’ Circus - the only Canadian tent circus in Canada. Filmed during a hectic summer season, with the Big Top up, in transit, or being erected, it vividly captures the 24-hour-a-day brand of circus magic and observes both the men and mechanics behind it. Like the circus itself, it hovers between comedy, sentimentality and the grotesque. An abridged version entitled ‘Little Big Top’ is also available. (Awards: Yorkton, Los Angeles)

results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park

results.title: High endeavour
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Martin Films
results.brief_description: The design, construction and testing of the Avro Vulcan, the world’s first four-jet delta-wing bomber, now playing an important role in Britain’s defence system. An historical introduction includes sequences on the Vulcan’s famous predecessor, the Lancaster, and shows some of its wartime exploits.

results.title: High country children of New Zealand
results.creator_credit: Dave Gibson, Yvonne MacKay and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Two children - Malcolm and Nerelli Prouting - live with their family on a sheep station in the isolated high country of south New Zealand. This film shows their daily lives from the excitement of mustering high up in the hills to mundane correspondence school work. Filmed on location at Mount Arrowsmith Station, New Zealand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dave Gibson, Yvonne MacKay and Gibson Film Productions

results.title: High art
results.creator_credit: Julie Shiels, Michael Buckley and North Richmond Community Health Centre
results.brief_description:
The North Richmond Community Health Centre has an extensive Arts and Culture program which invites community members to describe and celebrate their culture and ideas. The HIGH ART CDROM is a documentation of more than 14 projects and uses video, animations, interviews and graphics to exhibit the work.

HIGH ART also expores the more complex elements of cultural diversity by asking a number of questions including, “What is a community and who belongs to it? Is it where they live or how they live? Can art make you healthy? If it does, is it art or is it therapy? Do migrants get a fair go in the media? What does multiculturalism mean at the end of the 20th century

Also included in the CDROM is a series of essays that describe and evaluate the relationship between art and health.

results.title: High Arctic: life on the land
results.creator_credit: Dalton Muir, Hugh O'Connor, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An ecological study, in full colour, of plant and animal life on the Queen Elizabeth Islands in the Canadian Arctic, and of the life cycles that are the law of nature even in these frozen wastelands. Animals such as the musk-ox, lemming and arctic hare, and various forms of plant life, are seen as part of an evolution that began in pre-history. Commentary: Strowan Robertson
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dalton Muir, Hugh O’Connor, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
